sen.j: 和泉流（いずみ-りゅう）は狂言の流儀の一。
sen.e: The Izumi school is one of the schools of Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle).
The Izumi school is one of the schools of Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle).
The Izumi school is one of the schools of Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle).

sen.j: 現在、能楽協会に二十名あまりが登録し、東京都、名古屋市、金沢市などを基盤として活動する。
sen.e: At present, the Nohgaku Performers' Association has some 20 registered members who work mainly in Tokyo, Nagoya City and Kanazawa City and so on.
At present, the Nohgaku Performers' Association has some 20 registered members who work mainly in Tokyo, Nagoya City, and Kanazawa City.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary

Summary

sen.j: 家・派ごとの差違が大きく、芸の特徴を総体的に流儀としてまとめることはむずかしい。
sen.e: As differences between the families and schools are large, it is hard to generalize the features of this school as a whole.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As differences between the families and schools are large, it is hard to generalize the features of this school as a whole.
As differences between the families and schools are large, it is hard to generalize the features of this school as a whole.

sen.j: が、全体に大蔵流に比べ洒脱で洗練された表現が多く、あかるくやわらかみがあるといわれる。
sen.e: However, this school is said to have more refined and more sophisticated expressions than the Okura school, with soft and light-hearted atmosphere.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, this school is said to have more refined and more sophisticated expressions than the Okura school, with soft and light-hearted atmosphere.
However, this school is said to have more refined and more sophisticated expressions than the Okura school, with soft and light-hearted atmosphere.

sen.j: 流内は、芸系によって山脇和泉派（宗家派）、野村又三郎派、三宅藤九郎派に三分できる。
sen.e: The school can be separated into three different ha (school) depending on performances: IZUMI YAMAWAKI ha (Soke (the head family) ha), Matasaburo NOMURA ha and Tokuro MIYAKE ha.
The school can be separated into three different ha (school) depending on performances: IZUMI YAMAWAKI ha (Soke (the head family) ha), Matasaburo NOMURA ha, and Tokuro MIYAKE ha.
The school can be separated into three different ha (school) depending on performances: IZUMI YAMAWAKI ha (Soke (the head family) ha), Matasaburo NOMURA ha, and Tokuro MIYAKE ha.

sen.j: 流祖は室町時代中期に近江国坂本 (大津市)に住まった佐々木岳楽軒とされるがにわかには信じがたい。
sen.e: The founder of the school is said to be Gakurakuken SASAKI, who lived in Sakamoto, the Province of Omi (Otsu City) in the mid-Muromachi period, but this is not so convincing.
The founder of the school is said to be Gakurakuken SASAKI, who lived in Sakamoto, the Province of Omi (Otsu City) in the mid-Muromachi period, but this is not very convincing.
The founder of the school is said to be Gakurakuken SASAKI, who lived in Sakamoto, the Province of Omi (Otsu City) in the mid-Muromachi period, but this is not very convincing.

sen.j: 実質的な祖は鳥飼元光で、摂津国猿楽の鳥飼座に属したのち京都に出て手猿楽の役者として活躍し、和泉守の守領号を下賜されたといわれる。
sen.e: The actual founder is said to be 鳥飼元光, who belonged to Torikai za (a troupe of Sarugaku (form of theater popular in Japan during the 11th to 14th centuries)) of Settsu Province sarugaku, was later active as a tesarugaku (amateur noh) actor and was granted a shuryogo as Izuminokami Guard.
sen.cmt: 鳥飼元光の読み方がわかりませんでした。守領号の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: The actual founder is said to be 鳥飼元光, who belonged to Torikai za (a troupe of Sarugaku (form of theater popular in Japan during the 11th to 14th centuries)) of Settsu Province sarugaku, was later active as a tesarugaku (amateur noh) actor, and was granted a shuryogo as Izuminokami Guard.

The actual founder is said to be 鳥飼元光, who belonged to Torikai za (a troupe of Sarugaku (form of theater popular in Japan during the 11th to 14th centuries)) of Settsu Province sarugaku, was later active as a tesarugaku (amateur noh) actor, and was granted a shuryogo as Izuminokami Guard.

sen.j: その芸系は初期狂言に大きな足跡を残した日吉万五郎の系譜に属するものと思われ、鷺流、大蔵流と同源に発している。
sen.e: Its performance is thought to belong to the line of Mangoro HIYOSHI, who made a great contribution to early Kyogen, the same source as the Sagi school and Okura school.
Its performance is thought to belong to the line of Mangoro HIYOSHI, who made a great contribution to early Kyogen, the same source as the Sagi school and the Okura school.
Its performance is thought to belong to the line of Mangoro HIYOSHI, who made a great contribution to early Kyogen, the same source as the Sagi school and the Okura school.

sen.j: 鳥飼和泉守元光の子、山脇和泉元宜は慶長19年（1614年）に尾張徳川家に召抱えられ、名古屋に地盤を伸ばすと
sen.e: Motoyoshi YAMAWAKIIZUMI, a son of Izuminokami Guard 鳥飼元光, was employed by the Owari Tokugawa family in 1614, gaining a footing in Nagoya
sen.cmt: 鳥飼元光の読み方がわかりませんでした。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Motoyoshi YAMAWAKIIZUMI, a son of Izuminokami Guard 鳥飼元光, was employed by the Owari Tokugawa family in 1614, gaining a footing in Nagoya
Motoyoshi YAMAWAKIIZUMI, a son of Izuminokami Guard 鳥飼元光, was employed by the Owari Tokugawa family in 1614, gaining a footing in Nagoya.
sen.cmt: ピリオドをつけました。

sen.j: ともに、京都の手猿楽役者であった野村又三郎と三宅藤九郎を客分として招き、京都を地盤として和泉流を創設し、禁裏能などで活躍した。
sen.e: While inviting two tesarugaku actors from Kyoto, Matasaburo NOMURA and Tokuro MIYAKE, he also established the Izumi school with its base in Kyoto and played an active role in Kinri (the Imperial Palace) Noh.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While inviting two tesarugaku actors from Kyoto, Matasaburo NOMURA and Tokuro MIYAKE, he also established the Izumi school with its base in Kyoto and played an active role in Kinri (the Imperial Palace) Noh.

While inviting two tesarugaku actors from Kyoto, Matasaburo NOMURA and Tokuro MIYAKE, he also established the Izumi school with its base in Kyoto and played an active role in Kinri (the Imperial Palace) Noh.

sen.j: 以降、宗家は尾張家の扶持を受けながら京都に住まったが、四世山脇和泉元知のときに名古屋に移住し、十世山脇和泉元清の代に明治維新を迎えて東京都に移った。
sen.e: From then on, Soke had lived in Kyoto with fuchi (stipend) from the Owari family until Mototomo YAMAWAKIIZUMI, the fourth moved to Nagoya, and then Motokiyo YAMAWAKIIZUMI, 10th, to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 四世山脇和泉元知、十世山脇和泉元清の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: From then on, Soke lived in Kyoto with fuchi (a stipend) from the Owari family until Mototomo YAMAWAKIIZUMI, the fourth moved to Nagoya, and then Motokiyo YAMAWAKIIZUMI, 10th, to Tokyo.
From then on, Soke lived in Kyoto with fuchi (a stipend) from the Owari family until Mototomo YAMAWAKIIZUMI, the fourth moved to Nagoya, and then Motokiyo YAMAWAKIIZUMI, 10th, to Tokyo.

sen.j: 流儀の芸風・台本は家・派ごとに相当に異なる。
sen.e: The performances and scripts vary a great deal according to family and ha.
The performances and scripts vary a great deal according to family and ha.
The performances and scripts vary a great deal according to family and ha.

sen.j: これは当初から和泉流が、その起源となった京手猿楽の芸系を保ちつつ三派連合のゆるやかな集合体であったことに由来する。
sen.e: This came from the fact that while the Izumi school was a flexible assembly of three ha, it had kept its own lines of Kyoto tesarugaku performances, which were its origin from outset.
This came from the fact that while the Izumi school was a flexible assembly of three ha, it had kept its own lines of Kyoto tesarugaku performances, which were its origin from outset.
This came from the fact that while the Izumi school was a flexible assembly of three ha, it had kept its own lines of Kyoto tesarugaku performances, which were its origin from outset.

sen.j: 現行曲は254番と、大蔵流に比べてかなり多く、歌謡を重視した台本や演出に独自性がある。
sen.e: The Izumi school currently has a repertoire of 254 pieces, which is a much larger number than that of the Okura school, with its originality coming from scripts and stage effects attaching more importance to songs and ballads.

The Izumi school currently has a repertoire of 254 pieces, which is a much larger number than that of the Okura school, with its originality coming from scripts and stage effects attaching more importance to songs and ballads.

The Izumi school currently has a repertoire of 254 pieces, which is a much larger number than that of the Okura school, with its originality coming from scripts and stage effects attaching more importance to songs and ballads.

sen.j: なお天理図書館蔵狂言六義が流儀の最古本（江戸時代初期）であるが、成立が遅かったこともあり、天理本の時点から大きな変化はあまり見られない。
sen.e: Although the oldest volume of the school (from the early Edo period) is Kyogen rikugi which is housed in the Tenri Central Library, very little has been changed from that time due to the fact that it was developed at a late date.

Although the oldest volume of the school (from the early Edo period) is Kyogen rikugi which is housed in the Tenri Central Library, very little has been changed from that time due to the fact that it was developed at a late date.

Although the oldest volume of the school (from the early Edo period) is Kyogen rikugi which is housed in the Tenri Central Library, very little has been changed from that time due to the fact that it was developed at a late date.

sen.j: 流儀の家・派としては、宗家派の系統に狂言共同社（名古屋）、野村派に野村又三郎家、三宅派に野村万蔵家・万作家、三宅右近家、現三宅藤九郎家がある。
sen.e: Families and ha of this school include: Kyogen Kyodosha (The Kyogen Collective) in the line of the Soke ha, the Matasaburo NOMURA family for the Nomura ha and the Manzo NOMURA family, the Mansaku family, the Ukon MIYAKE family and the current Tokuro MIYAKE family in the Miyake ha.

Families and ha of this school include: Kyogen Kyodosha (The Kyogen Collective) in the line of the Soke ha, the Matasaburo NOMURA family for the Nomura ha, and the Manzo NOMURA family, the Mansaku family, the Ukon MIYAKE family, and the current Tokuro MIYAKE family in the Miyake ha.

Families and ha of this school include: Kyogen Kyodosha (The Kyogen Collective) in the line of the Soke ha, the Matasaburo NOMURA family for the Nomura ha, and the Manzo NOMURA family, the Mansaku family, the Ukon MIYAKE family, and the current Tokuro MIYAKE family in the Miyake ha.

sen.j: 1995年、十三世宗家和泉元秀の死去後、和泉流は宗家を定めておらず、能楽に関する決め事については、和泉流職分会 （会長：野村萬、代表幹事：井上菊次郎） における会員合議制を取っている。
sen.e: Since the death of the 13th Soke Motohide IZUMI in 1995, the Izumi school does not have Soke so that decisions regarding Nogaku (Noh and Kyogen) are made by a membership council system called Izumi-ryu shokubunkai (Chair: Man NOMURA, Secretary Kikujiro INOUE).

Since the death of the 13th Soke Motohide IZUMI in 1995, the Izumi school does not have Soke, and decisions regarding Nogaku (Noh and Kyogen) are made by a membership council system called Izumi-ryu shokubunkai (Chair: Man NOMURA, Secretary Kikujiro INOUE).

Since the death of the 13th Soke Motohide IZUMI in 1995, the Izumi school does not have Soke, and decisions regarding Nogaku (Noh and Kyogen) are made by a membership council system called Izumi-ryu shokubunkai (Chair: Man NOMURA, Secretary: Kikujiro INOUE).

sen.j: （和泉元彌の項「宗家継承騒動」参照）
sen.e: Refer to the section of 'disturbance over succession of Soke' in Motoya IZUMI.
Refer to the section of 'disturbance over succession of Soke' in Motoya IZUMI.
Refer to the section of 'disturbance over succession of Soke' in Motoya IZUMI.

sen.j: 狂言共同社（宗家派・名古屋）
sen.e: Kyogen Kyodosha (Soke ha/Nagoya)
Kyogen Kyodosha (Soke ha/Nagoya)
Kyogen Kyodosha (Soke ha/Nagoya)

sen.j: 明治維新の折、宗家が東京へ移住した後に、名古屋に居残った弟子が芸系保持のため、1891年に結成した会派。
sen.e: After the Soke, the head family, moved to Tokyo at the time of Meiji Restoration, pupils who stayed in Nagoya established this group in 1891 to maintain its performances.
After the Soke, the head family, moved to Tokyo at the time of the Meiji Restoration, pupils who stayed in Nagoya established this group in 1891 to maintain its performances.
After the Soke, the head family, moved to Tokyo at the time of the Meiji Restoration, pupils who stayed in Nagoya established this group in 1891 to maintain its performances.

sen.j: 旧宗家が断絶してしまった現在においては、山脇和泉派の芸系を引く唯一の会派でもある（ただし一部には同じく名古屋を本拠としていた野村又三郎派の芸系をも交える）。
sen.e: Now that the original Soke have died out, this is the only group which succeeds the styles of Yamawaki Izumi ha performances (although this group had some influence from the Matasaburo NOMURA ha which was also based on Nagoya).

Now that the original Soke have died out, this is the only group which succeeds the styles of Yamawaki Izumi ha performances (although this group had some influence from the Matasaburo NOMURA ha which was also based on Nagoya).

Now that the original Soke have died out, this is the only group which succeeds the styles of Yamawaki Izumi ha performances (although this group had some influence from the Matasaburo NOMURA ha which was also based on Nagoya).

sen.j: 名古屋の和泉流狂言師には、別に生業を持つ手猿楽的な役者が多かったため、比較的ゆるやかなつながりで開明的な傾向を持っている。
sen.e: As Izumi school Kyogen performers in Nagoya were mostly half-amateur noh performers, who had other jobs to make their livings, they tend to be open and liberal and to have a relatively loose bond among them.

As Izumi school Kyogen performers in Nagoya were mostly half-amateur noh performers, who had other jobs to make their livings, they tended to be open and liberal and to have a relatively loose bond among them.

As Izumi school Kyogen performers in Nagoya were mostly half-amateur noh performers, who had other jobs to make their livings, they tended to be open and liberal and to have a relatively loose bond among them.

sen.j: 初期の代表的な役者に初代井上菊次郎や狂言画で有名な伊勢門水がおり、現在では井上家の子孫である井上菊次郎（四代目）が中心となっている。
sen.e: The most important actors from the early time of this group include the first Kikujiro INOUE and Monsui ISE, who is famous for his Kyogenga pictures, and at present, Kikujiro INOUE (the fourth), the descendant of the Inoue family, leads the group.

The most important actors from the early time of this group include the first Kikujiro INOUE and Monsui ISE, who is famous for his Kyogenga pictures, and at present, Kikujiro INOUE (the fourth), a descendant of the Inoue family, leads the group.

The most important actors from the early time of this group include the first Kikujiro INOUE and Monsui ISE, who is famous for his Kyogenga pictures, and at present, Kikujiro INOUE (the fourth), a descendant of the Inoue family, leads the group.

sen.j: 芸風はあかるくやわらかみのつよい華やかなものである。
sen.e: Its performance is bright, rather soft and elegant.
Its performance is bright, rather soft and elegant.
Its performance is bright, rather soft and elegant.

sen.j: 野村又三郎家（野村派・名古屋）
sen.e: Matasaburo NOMURA Family (Nomura ha/Nagoya)
Matasaburo NOMURA Family (Nomura ha/Nagoya)
The Matasaburo NOMURA Family (Nomura ha/Nagoya)

sen.j: もともと京都の手猿楽に発した家系で、初代野村又三郎重信が和泉流樹立にあたり客分として招かれたために、独自の演目・台本・演出などを保持して現在に至っている。
sen.e: This family originally performed tesarugaku in Kyoto and as Shigenobu NOMURAMATASABURO (the first) was invited as a guest to establish the Izumi school, their own programs, play scripts and dramatic interpretation have been maintained.
sen.cmt: 初代野村又三郎重信の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: This family originally performed tesarugaku in Kyoto, and as Shigenobu NOMURAMATASABURO (the first) was invited as a guest to establish the Izumi school, their own programs, play scripts, and dramatic interpretation have been maintained.

This family originally performed tesarugaku in Kyoto, and as Matasaburo Shigenobu NOMURA (the first) was invited as a guest to establish the Izumi school, their own programs, play scripts, and dramatic interpretation have been maintained.
sen.cmt: 「Shigenobu NOMURAMATASABURO」を「Matasaburo Shigenobu NOMURA」に修正しました。

sen.j: 三世野村又三郎信明の代に在京のまま尾張藩に扶持されるようになり、明治維新後に名古屋、東京と移住を重ねた。
sen.e: At the time of Nobuaki NOMURA MATASABURO the third, the family was granted fuchi by the Owari Clan while living in Kyoto, and after the Meiji Restoration the family moved to Nagoya and then to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 三世野村又三郎信明の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: At the time of Nobuaki NOMURA MATASABURO the third, the family was granted fuchi by the Owari Clan while living in Kyoto, and after the Meiji Restoration the family moved to Nagoya and then to Tokyo.
At the time of Matasaburo Nobuaki NOMURA the third, the family was granted fuchi by the Owari Clan while living in Kyoto, and after the Meiji Restoration the family moved to Nagoya and then to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 「Nobuaki NOMURA MATASABURO」を「Matasaburo Nobuaki NOMURA」に修正しました。

sen.j: 十一世野村又三郎信英が不慮の戦死を遂げるなどしたために、派としてはやや少人数である。
sen.e: However, as Nobuhide NOMURA MATASABURO the 11th suddenly died in a war, the group remained small in number.
sen.cmt: 十一世野村又三郎信英の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: However, as Nobuhide NOMURA MATASABURO the 11th suddenly died in a war, the group remained small in number.
However, as Matasaburo Nobuhide NOMURA, the eleventh suddenly died in a war, the group remained small in number.
sen.cmt: 「Nobuhide NOMURA MATASABURO」を「Matasaburo Nobuhide NOMURA」に修正しました。「the 11th」を「, the eleventh」に修正しました。

sen.j: （十二世の野村又三郎信廣は2007年12月12日に死去。享年86）
sen.e: (Nobuhiro NOMURA MATASABURO the 12th died on December 12th 2007, aged 86.)
sen.cmt: 享年86）が下のコラムに入っていましたので、こちらに移動しました。
sen.e: (Nobuhiro NOMURA MATASABURO the 12th died on December 12th 2007, aged 86.)
(Matasaburo Nobuhiro NOMURA, the twelfth died on December 12th 2007, aged 86.)
sen.cmt: 「Nobuhiro NOMURA MATASABURO」を「Matasaburo Nobuhiro NOMURA」に修正しました。「12th」を「, the twelfth」に修正しました。

sen.j: 芸風は全体におとなしやかで、幽玄なやわらかみがまさっており、和泉流の中でも特に式楽としての品を意識する傾向が強いと言われる。
sen.e: Their performances are generally calm, rather subtle and soft, and among the Izumi school, they are said to have a special tendency to care more about grace as the music and plays for official ceremonies.

Their performances are generally calm, rather subtle and soft, and among the Izumi school, they are said to have a special tendency to care more about grace as the music and plays for official ceremonies.

Their performances are generally calm, rather subtle and soft, and among the Izumi school, they are said to have a special tendency to care more about grace as the music and plays for official ceremonies.

sen.j: 野村万蔵家（三宅派・東京）
sen.e: Manzo NOMURA Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
Manzo NOMURA Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
The Manzo NOMURA Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)

sen.j: 三宅派は、野村又三郎派と同じく、もと京都の手猿楽役者であった三宅藤九郎が和泉流樹立にあたって客分として招かれたもので、後に三世三宅藤九郎喜納が在京のまま加賀藩の扶持を受けたため、その芸系が加賀に伝播した。
sen.e: Like the Matasaburo Nomura ha, the Miyake ha started when Tokuro MIYAKE, a tesarugaku actor in Kyoto, was invited as a guest to establish the Izumi school, and later, as 三世三宅藤九郎喜納 was granted fuchi by the Kaga Clan while living in Kyoto, their performances spread in Kaga Province.
sen.cmt: 三世三宅藤九郎喜納の読み方がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: Like the Matasaburo Nomura ha, the Miyake ha started when Tokuro MIYAKE, a tesarugaku actor in Kyoto, was invited as a guest to establish the Izumi school, and later, as 三世三宅藤九郎喜納 was granted fuchi by the Kaga Clan while living in Kyoto, their performances spread in Kaga Province.

Like the Matasaburo NOMURA school, the Miyake school started when Tokuro MIYAKE, a tesarugaku actor in Kyoto, was invited as a guest to establish the Izumi school, and later, as 三宅藤九郎喜納, the third was granted fuchi by the Kaga Clan while living in Kyoto, their performances spread in Kaga Province.
sen.cmt: 「Matasaburo Nomura ha」を「Matasaburo NOMURA school」に修正しました。「ha」を「school」に修正しました。「三世三宅藤九郎喜納」を「三宅藤九郎喜納, the third」に修正しました。

sen.j: 加賀在の手猿楽役者として活躍した初代野村万蔵保尚の家系がこれである。
sen.e: This is the family of the first Yasuhisa NOMURAMANZO who was active as a tesarugaku actor in Kaga Province.
This is the family of the first Yasuhisa NOMURAMANZO, who was active as a tesarugaku actor in Kaga Province.
This is the family of the first Manzo Yasuhisa NOMURA, who was active as a tesarugaku actor in Kaga Province.
sen.cmt: 「Yasuhisa NOMURAMANZO」を「Manzo Yasuhisa NOMURA」に修正しました。

sen.j: 明治維新の際、七世三宅庄市は京より東京へ移住し、和泉流を代表する名手として活躍したが、後嗣に人を得なかったために三宅家は八世三宅藤九郎信之をもって断絶する。
sen.e: The 7th Shoichi MIYAKE moved from Kyoto to Tokyo during the Meiji Restoration and was active as a great actor that represented the Izumi school: however, as he did not have any successors the MIYAKE family died out after Nobuyuki Tokuro MIYAKE, the eighth.
sen.cmt: 八世三宅藤九郎信之の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: The 7th Shoichi MIYAKE moved from Kyoto to Tokyo during the Meiji Restoration and was active as a great actor who represented the Izumi school: however, as he did not have any successors the MIYAKE family died out after Nobuyuki Tokuro MIYAKE, the eighth.

The 7th Shoichi MIYAKE moved from Kyoto to Tokyo during the Meiji Restoration and was active as a great actor who represented the Izumi school: however, as he did not have any successors the MIYAKE family died out after Nobuyuki Tokuro MIYAKE, the eighth.

sen.j: 以降、三宅派の芸系は、やや遅れて加賀より上京した五世野村万造（初世萬斎）によって受継がれ、名人といわれた野村万蔵 (6世)（人間国宝）、七世野村万蔵（現野村万蔵七世野村万蔵。人間国宝）と相続して現在に至っている。
sen.e: Since then, the tradition of the performances of the Miyake ha was inherited by Manzo NOMURA, the fifth (Mansai, the first) who went from Kaga Province to Tokyo a little later, and it was passed down to Manzo NOMURA, the sixth (Living National Treasure) who was recognized as a master actor and then to current Manzo NOMURA, the seventh (Living National Treasure) through time until now.
sen.cmt: ()内に句点があり、文が分割されていましたので、一つにまとめました。
sen.e: Since then, the tradition of the performances of the Miyake ha was inherited by Manzo NOMURA, the fifth (Mansai, the first) who went from Kaga Province to Tokyo a little later, and it was passed down to Manzo NOMURA, the sixth (Living National Treasure) who was recognized as a master actor and then to current Manzo NOMURA, the seventh (Living National Treasure) through time until now.

Since then, the tradition of the performances of the Miyake ha was inherited by Manzo NOMURA, the fifth (Mansai, the first) who went from Kaga Province to Tokyo a little later, and it was passed down to Manzo NOMURA, the sixth (Living National Treasure) who was recognized as a master actor and then to current Manzo NOMURA, the seventh (Living National Treasure) through time until now.

sen.j: 五世万蔵のとき、次男の野村万介に分家させて、三宅藤九郎の名跡を復興させ、さらに六世万蔵の次男野村二朗が野村万作を名乗っている。
sen.e: At the time of Manzo, the fifth, his second son Mansuke NOMURA set up a branch family and succeeded the name of 'Tokuro MIYAKE' which had been discontinued while Jiro NOMURA, the second son of Manzo, the sixth styled himself Mansaku NOMURA.

At the time of Manzo, the fifth, his second son Mansuke NOMURA set up a branch family and succeeded the name of 'Tokuro MIYAKE' which had been discontinued while Jiro NOMURA, the second son of Manzo, the sixth styled himself Mansaku NOMURA.

At the time of Manzo, the fifth, his second son Mansuke NOMURA set up a branch family and succeeded the name of 'Tokuro MIYAKE' which had been discontinued while Jiro NOMURA, the second son of Manzo, the sixth styled himself Mansaku NOMURA.

sen.j: 現在では野村万蔵家に、当主九世野村万蔵（早世した野村万之丞＝追贈八世野村万蔵の弟）、先代当主野村萬を筆頭に小笠原匡など若手狂言師の活躍も目立つ。
sen.e: At present, in the Manzo NOMURA family, there are young Kyogen actors like Tadashi OGASAWARA who are playing active roles, with the family head Manzo NOMURA, the ninth (a younger brother of Mannojo NOMURA who died young and was conferred the style of Manzo NOMURA, the eighth posthumously) and the former family head Man NOMURA leading them.

At present, in the Manzo NOMURA family, there are young Kyogen actors, such as Tadashi OGASAWARA, who are playing active roles, with the family head Manzo NOMURA, the ninth (a younger brother of Mannojo NOMURA who died young and was conferred the style of Manzo NOMURA, the eighth posthumously) and the former family head Man NOMURA leading them.

At present, in the Manzo NOMURA family, there are young Kyogen actors, such as Tadashi OGASAWARA, who are playing active roles, with the family head Manzo NOMURA, the ninth (a younger brother of Mannojo NOMURA who died young and was conferred the style of Manzo NOMURA, the eighth posthumously) and the former family head Man NOMURA leading them.

sen.j: 芸風は特に上京以降、和泉流のやわらかさを残しつつ瀟洒で洗練を経た風をつよめ、俗に「江戸前狂言」などと呼ばれたりもする。
sen.e: After they moved to Tokyo, their performances changed to enhance its smart and refined style while retaining the characteristic softness of the Izumi school, and it is sometimes called ' Edomae (Tokyo style) kyogen.'

After they moved to Tokyo, their performances changed to enhance their smart and refined style while retaining the characteristic softness of the Izumi school, and it is sometimes called ' Edomae (Tokyo style) kyogen.'

After they moved to Tokyo, their performances changed to enhance their smart and refined style while retaining the characteristic softness of the Izumi school, and it is sometimes called ' Edomae (Tokyo style) kyogen.'

sen.j: 野村万作家（三宅派・東京）
sen.e: The Mansaku NOMURA Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
The Mansaku NOMURA Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
The Mansaku NOMURA Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)

sen.j: 1994年に野村万蔵家と野村万作の長男・武司（現萬斎）の襲名を巡って争い、袂を別ち「万作の会」を立ち上げる。
sen.e: In 1994, there was a dispute over succession to the name between the Manzo NOMURA family and Mansaku NOMURA's first son, Takeshi (current Mansai), which led to a separation of the group, with Mansaku NOMURA setting up 'Mansaku no kai (the kyogen performance group).'

In 1994, there was a dispute over succession to the name between the Manzo NOMURA family and Mansaku NOMURA's first son, Takeshi (current Mansai), which led to a separation of the group, with Mansaku NOMURA setting up 'Mansaku no kai (the kyogen performance group).'

In 1994, there was a dispute over succession to the name between the Manzo NOMURA family and Mansaku NOMURA's first son, Takeshi (current Mansai), which led to a separation of the group, with Mansaku NOMURA setting up 'Mansaku no kai (the kyogen performance group).'

sen.j: 万作を始め6世野村万蔵の五男・野村万之介や長男・野村萬斎、弟子の石田幸雄を中心に幅広い活動を展開する。
sen.e: This group includes Mansaku, his first son Mansai NOMURA, Mannosuke NOMURA who is the fifth son of Manzo NOMURA the sixth, and their follower Yukio ISHIDA, and with all of them leading the group, it has been active in a variety of fields.

This group includes Mansaku, his first son Mansai NOMURA, Mannosuke NOMURA who is the fifth son of Manzo NOMURA the sixth, and their follower Yukio ISHIDA, and with all of them leading the group, it has been active in a variety of fields.

This group includes Mansaku, his first son Mansai NOMURA, Mannosuke NOMURA who is the fifth son of Manzo NOMURA the sixth, and their follower Yukio ISHIDA, and with all of them leading the group, it has been active in a variety of fields.

sen.j: 2007年7月には当主野村万作が重要無形文化財個人指定（人間国宝）に認定され、現在狂言界で最も隆盛を極めている一派である。
sen.e: In July, 2007, the family head Mansaku NOMURA was designated the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure), making this group the most prosperous in the current world of Kyogen.

In July, 2007, the family head Mansaku NOMURA was designated the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure), making this group the most prosperous in the current world of Kyogen.

In July, 2007, the family head Mansaku NOMURA was designated the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure), making this group the most prosperous in the current world of Kyogen.

sen.j: その活動範囲は広く、特に息子・野村萬斎はテレビドラマ出演や舞台演出を手掛けるなど各方面に精力的な姿勢を見せている。
sen.e: They work in a range of fields and Mansaku's son Mansai NOMURA in particular has been working tirelessly in different fields, such as appearing in TV drama series and producing theatrical plays.
They work in a range of fields and Mansaku's son Mansai NOMURA in particular has been working tirelessly in different fields, such as appearing in TV drama series and producing theatrical plays.
They work in a range of fields and Mansaku's son Mansai NOMURA in particular has been working tirelessly in different fields, such as appearing in TV drama series and producing theatrical plays.

sen.j: また、国立能楽堂能楽三役第四期研修終了の深田博治、高野和憲など若手狂言師も着々と育ってきている。
sen.e: Also, there are some new Kyogen actors growing steadily in this group such as Hiroharu FUKATA and Kazunori TAKANO, who finished the 4th Nogaku sanyaku (three roles of Nogaku) training at the National Noh Theatre.

Also, there are some new Kyogen actors growing steadily in this group such as Hiroharu FUKATA and Kazunori TAKANO, who finished the 4th Nogaku sanyaku (three roles of Nogaku) training at the National Noh Theatre.

Also, there are some new Kyogen actors growing steadily in this group such as Hiroharu FUKATA and Kazunori TAKANO, who finished the fourth Nogaku sanyaku (three roles of Nogaku) training at the National Noh Theatre.

sen.j: 三宅右近家（三宅派・東京）
sen.e: The Ukon MIYAKE Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
The Ukon MIYAKE Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
The Ukon MIYAKE Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)

sen.j: 五世野村万蔵の次男万介は流儀の了承を得て九世三宅藤九郎を襲名し、三宅藤九郎家を復興した。
sen.e: The second son of Manzo NOMURA, the fifth, Mansuke, succeeded to the name of Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth, with a consent from the school and reestablished the Tokuro MIYAKE family.
The second son of Manzo NOMURA, the fifth, Mansuke, succeeded to the name of Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth, with the consent of the school and reestablished the Tokuro MIYAKE family.
The second son of Manzo NOMURA, the fifth, Mansuke, succeeded to the name of Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth, with the consent of the school and reestablished the Tokuro MIYAKE family.

sen.j: 九世藤九郎には2人の息子があり、長男は宗家復興のため山脇家の養子となり、芸名を和泉元秀と名乗る。
sen.e: The ninth Tokuro had two sons and the first son was adopted into the Yamawaki family to reestablish the Soke, styling himself Motohide IZUMI.
The ninth Tokuro had two sons; the first son was adopted into the Yamawaki family to reestablish the Soke, styling himself Motohide IZUMI.
The ninth Tokuro had two sons; the first son was adopted into the Yamawaki family to reestablish the Soke, styling himself Motohide IZUMI.

sen.j: 次男が三宅藤九郎家の家系を守って三宅右近を名乗り現在に至っている。
sen.e: The second son styles himself Ukon MIYAKE, keeping the tradition of the Tokuro MIYAKE family up until now.
The second son styles himself Ukon MIYAKE, keeping the tradition of the Tokuro MIYAKE family up until now.
The second son styles himself Ukon MIYAKE, keeping the tradition of the Tokuro MIYAKE family up until now.

sen.j: 芸風は野村万蔵家と大きく変らないが、本狂言においては世話物的写実性が目立つ一方で、間狂言では式楽的な上品さが強調されるようである。
sen.e: Although their performances are not so different from those of the Manzo NOMURA family, in Hon Kyogen (played independently, this normally is the one generally called Kyogen), realism which is often seen in plays dealing with the lives of ordinary people is highlighted while in Ai Kyogen (comic interlude in Noh) they emphasize the grace of the music and plays for official ceremonies.

Although their performances are not so different from those of the Manzo NOMURA family, in Hon Kyogen (played independently, this normally is the one generally called Kyogen), realism which is often seen in plays dealing with the lives of ordinary people is highlighted while in Ai Kyogen (comic interlude in Noh) they emphasize the grace of the music and plays for official ceremonies.

Although their performances are not so different from those of the Manzo NOMURA family, in Hon Kyogen (played independently, this normally is the one generally called Kyogen), realism which is often seen in plays dealing with the lives of ordinary people is highlighted while in Ai Kyogen (comic interlude in Noh) they emphasize the grace of the music and plays for official ceremonies.

sen.j: 右近の息子、右矩・近成も狂言方である。
sen.e: Ukon's two sons, Sukenori and Chikanari, are also Kyogen actors.
Ukon's two sons, Sukenori and Chikanari, are also Kyogen actors.
Ukon's two sons, Sukenori and Chikanari, are also Kyogen actors.

sen.j: 現三宅藤九郎家（三宅派・東京）
sen.e: The Current Tokuro MIYAKE Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
The Current Tokuro MIYAKE Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)
The Current Tokuro MIYAKE Family (Miyake ha/Tokyo)

sen.j: 和泉流宗家山脇和泉家は、明治維新後東京に移住したのち、十一世山脇元照をもって後嗣が絶えた。
sen.e: The Yamawaki Izumi family, the head family of the Izumi school which is called the Izumi ryu Soke, moved its base to Tokyo after the Meiji Restoration, but the lineage died out after Mototeru YAMAWAKI, the 11th.
sen.cmt: 十一世山脇元照の読み方が確認できませんでした。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Yamawaki Izumi family, the head family of the Izumi school which is called the Izumi ryu Soke, moved its base to Tokyo after the Meiji Restoration, but the lineage died out after Mototeru YAMAWAKI, the 11th.

The Yamawaki Izumi family, the head family of the Izumi school which is called the Izumi ryu Soke, moved its base to Tokyo after the Meiji Restoration, but the lineage died out after Mototeru YAMAWAKI, the 11th.

sen.j: その後、十二世山脇元康が十一世の遺子と縁組みをして宗家を継承したものの、女性問題や芸力の不足によって流内の統一をはかることができず、ついに狂言を廃して、和泉流は宗家不在の状態となった。
sen.e: Then, Motoyasu YAMAWAKI, the 12th married a daughter of Mototeru YAMAWAKI, the 11th, becoming an heir to the Soke family: however, he was unable to bring the school together due to love affairs and lack of talent, and in the end, he retired from Kyogen, leaving the Izumi school without a Soke head.
sen.cmt: 十二世山脇元康の読み方が確認できませんでした。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, Motoyasu YAMAWAKI, the 12th married a daughter of Mototeru YAMAWAKI, the 11th, becoming an heir to the Soke family: however, he was unable to bring the school together due to love affairs and lack of talent, and in the end, he retired from Kyogen, leaving the Izumi school without a Soke head.

Then, Motoyasu YAMAWAKI, the twelfth married a daughter of Mototeru YAMAWAKI, the eleventh, becoming an heir to the Soke family: however, he was unable to bring the school together due to love affairs and lack of talent, and in the end, he retired from Kyogen, leaving the Izumi school without a Soke head.
sen.cmt: 「11th」を「eleventh」に修正しました。「12th」を「twelfth」に修正しました。

sen.j: 野村又三郎家、三宅藤九郎家、野村万蔵家といった有力な職分家が活発に活動していたこともあり、宗家の不在は長らくつづいた。
sen.e: As powerful occupational branch families such as the Matasaburo NOMURA family, the Tokuro MIYAKE family and the Manzo NOMURA family were active, the absence of the head family, Soke, continued for a long time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As powerful occupational branch families such as the Matasaburo NOMURA family, the Tokuro MIYAKE family, and the Manzo NOMURA family were active, the absence of the head family, Soke, continued for a long time.

As powerful occupational branch families such as the Matasaburo NOMURA family, the Tokuro MIYAKE family, and the Manzo NOMURA family were active, the absence of the head family, Soke, continued for a long time.

sen.j: しかし、1943年、流内の推挙によって、九世三宅藤九郎の長男保之が、十世山脇元清の娘の養子に入って十三世宗家山脇元秀、のち和泉元秀を名乗る。
sen.e: However, in 1943, Yasuyuki, the first son of Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth was recommended by members of the school to succeed the family by being adopted by the daughter of Motokiyo YAMAWAKI, the 10th, becoming Motohide YAMAWAKI, the 13th Soke and later styling himself Motohide IZUMI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in 1943, Yasuyuki, the first son of Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth was recommended by members of the school to succeed the family by being adopted by the daughter of Motokiyo YAMAWAKI, the 10th, becoming Motohide YAMAWAKI, the 13th Soke and later styling himself Motohide IZUMI.

However, in 1943, Yasuyuki, the first son of Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth was recommended by members of the school to succeed the family by being adopted by the daughter of Motokiyo YAMAWAKI, the tenth, becoming Motohide YAMAWAKI, the thirteenth Soke and later styling himself Motohide IZUMI.
sen.cmt: 「10th」を「tenth」に修正しました。「13th」を「thirteenth」に修正しました。

sen.j: 1995年の元秀急逝の後は長男・和泉元彌がこれを継承したと宣言したが、元秀宗家相続のさいの経緯があるにもかかわらず、元彌が流内の同意を得ることなく一方的に宣言。
sen.e: After Motohide's sudden death in 1995, his first son Motoya IZUMI declared his succession to the Soke family: however, it was a unilateral action without any consent from other members of the school, never taking into consideration the circumstances of Motohide's succession to the Soke family.

After Motohide's sudden death in 1995, his first son Motoya IZUMI declared his succession to the Soke family: however, it was a unilateral action without any consent from other members of the school, never taking into consideration the circumstances of Motohide's succession to the Soke family.

After Motohide's sudden death in 1995, his first son Motoya IZUMI declared his succession to the Soke family: however, it was a unilateral action without any consent from other members of the school, never taking into consideration the circumstances of Motohide's succession to the Soke family.

sen.j: 加えて芸力の不足や度重なるトラブルとスキャンダルを引きおこしたこともあって、能楽協会からは退会命令（「除名」の次に重い処分、復帰の可能性は残されている）の処分を受け、流内職分から宗家相続無効を主張された。
sen.e: In addition, as he lacked talent and repeatedly caused troubles and scandals, he was given by the Nohgaku Performers' Association the order of withdrawal from membership (which is the second heaviest punishment after expulsion, but still leaves room for coming back) while occupational branch families in the school claimed that his succession should be invalid.

In addition, as he lacked talent and repeatedly caused troubles and scandals, he was given an order by the Nohgaku Performers' Association to withdraw from membership (which is the second heaviest punishment after expulsion, but still leaves room for coming back) while occupational branch families in the school claimed that his succession should be invalid.

In addition, as he lacked talent and repeatedly caused troubles and scandals, he was given an order by the Nohgaku Performers' Association to withdraw from membership (which is the second heaviest punishment after expulsion, but still leaves room for coming back) while occupational branch families in the school claimed that his succession should be invalid.

sen.j: 元彌側は裁判で争ったが、最高裁は、「原告は宗家と認められていない」と指摘、「退会命令も適法」と判断。
sen.e: Motoya's side brought the issue to court, but the Supreme Court pointed out the 'the plaintiff is not recognized as Soke,' and made the judgement that 'the order of withdrawal is legal.'
Motoya's side brought the issue to court, but the Supreme Court pointed out the 'the plaintiff is not recognized as Soke,' and made the judgement that 'the order of withdrawal is legal.'
Motoya's side brought the issue to court, but the Supreme Court pointed out the 'the plaintiff is not recognized as Soke,' and made the judgement that 'the order of withdrawal is legal.'

sen.j: 元彌の能楽協会退会が確定した。
sen.e: This made Motoya's withdrawal certain.
This made Motoya's withdrawal certain.
This made Motoya's withdrawal certain.

sen.j: （和泉元彌の項「宗家継承騒動」参照） 元秀の娘二人も狂言師となり、次女が十世三宅藤九郎を名乗っている。
sen.e: (Refer to the section of 'disturbance over succession of Soke' in Motoya IZUMI.) Two daughters of Motohide became Kyogen actors and the second one styles herself Tokuro MIYAKE, the 10th.
(Refer to the section of 'disturbance over succession of Soke' in Motoya IZUMI.) Two daughters of Motohide became Kyogen actors and the second one styles herself Tokuro MIYAKE, the 10th.
(Refer to the section of 'disturbance over succession of Soke' in Motoya IZUMI.) Two daughters of Motohide became Kyogen actors and the second one styles herself Tokuro MIYAKE, the tenth.

sen.j: 注）和泉家では、十三代目の宗家和泉元秀を十九世宗家とするなど、過去の宗家すべてに六つ上乗せした数字を付けている。
sen.e: Note that in the Izumi family, all the titles have added six numbers to their actual number: for example, Motohide IZUMI who is actually the 13th becomes the 19th Soke.
Note that in the Izumi family, all the titles have added six numbers to their actual number: for example, Motohide IZUMI, who is actually the 13th, becomes the 19th Soke.
Note that in the Izumi family, all the titles have added six numbers to their actual number: for example, Motohide IZUMI, who is actually the thirteenth, becomes the nineteenth Soke.
sen.cmt: 「19th」を「nineteenth」に修正しました。「13th」を「thirteenth」に修正しました。

sen.j: ここでは、初代から数えた実際の数字を記載した。
sen.e: However, all titles that appeared in this section adopted the actual number counting from the first.
However, all titles that appeared in this section adopted the actual number counting from the first.
However, all titles that appeared in this section adopted the actual number counting from the first.
